experience: You and John Paul both know Joel Wilson and Minerva Gonzalez
Every conference, almost without fail, I see companies spending crazy cash to get main stage time only to give dull thinly-veiled product pitches.
The fact that it continues to happen tells me these companies continue to think it’s a good idea.
When your presentation is dull, when it’s clearly a sales pitch, it will land flat 100% of the time.  You spend a lot of money to create value and throw it all away.

I can imagine the internal conversation because I’ve seen and heard it so many times.  We paid all this money, how can we not talk about our product?  This is the result of an internal echo-chamber that fails to understand what insights will truly engage an audience, ideas that will attract more prospects to you as a thought leader and not just a supplier.
Every time moving forward you see one of these terrible presentations, use it as a lesson and reminder to do the opposite when you have the opportunity for your company, or for yourself.

FloodGate is thrilled to officially announce a joint venture with Gale Healthcare Solutions, a technology company who has "uberized" the clinical staffing industry.  Our new company, Healiant, will give medical facilities and companies unparalleled access to field based, on demand, per diem, wound certified clinicians across the United States.  Our clinicians enjoy exciting work with the industry's top employers, super flexible work schedules and premium pay rates.  Healiant's clients enjoy immediate access to the industry's top wound specialist for case coverage, shift coverage, education, training, in-servicing and a host of of others solutions.  Please visit Healiant.com for more information or email specialists@healiant.com.  Big shot out to our partner, Chris Ogboke!

Focused on helping companies like Outback, Carrabba's and a bunch of startups take the guesswork out of their online campaigns and SEO by using data to understand user engagement. I have helped companies understand issues with their online experience and made improvements that have driven 133% improvement for our customers through conversion and engagement optimization. ●	Worked with the marketing teams at Outback.com to improve search engine rankings for non-branded terms.  Saw immediate improvements in 20% of targeted terms. ●	Led the product development for an iPad app at a national wallpaper distributor that displays available inventory and specifications for sales teams.●	Overhauled a large e-commerce catalog user experience that drove a 5% improvement in conversion rates within one month of A/B testing.●	Created a content marketing strategies that have driven 550% gains in customer's organic traffic.●	Development of both product strategy and marketing strategy for a B2C radio and podcast streaming application for mobile and desktop users.  The success of this strategy has led to both investor funding and a large product launch in 2014.

Drive the strategy for digital lead generation targeting the top retailers (IR500) and consumer brands. Responsible for managing conversion campaigns, lead generation, content management and the systems that support these efforts.• Optimized and implemented all email campaigns targeting CMO and Marketing Directors of the top worldwide retailers and international brands. This resulted in a 20% improvement in webinar registrations.• Redeveloped website informational architecture and page flow resulting in an increase of 35% in conversion traffic. Additionally, the content changes improved time on site by 40%.• Coached communications manager on social media and grew followers by 320% in 2 months.• Working with the Sales Team, developed the lead processing system for marketing qualified leads and sales qualified leads.• Created scoring profiles for each incoming conversion to prioritize delivery to the Sales Team or adding to nurturing tools.
Director of Global Web Services & Lead Generation

Created the strategic direction for global web marketing and implementation of corporate, multilingual websites. Additionally, was responsible for ensuring a high volume of quality leads through online forms from organic, direct, PPC and social channels.•	Reengineered the company’s standard web design practice to a conversion optimization strategy. In four years, this led to a 60% growth in lead opportunity from SEO to $35 million annually.•	Reorganized the PPC team and strategy by reallocating the budget toward more profitable keywords, redevelopment of landing pages and ad copy.  This effort improved conversion rates between 5-20% over the previous year and impacted the opportunity pipeline by $1.75 million per month.•	Implemented a web testing strategy (A/B and multivariate) to constantly analyze the user experience, improve the length of visitors’ time on site and increase the form conversions resulting in a 25%+ improvement in form conversion rate.•	Started company-wide social media communications campaign. Built a following of industry analysts and customers to over 3,000 within a 6 month period and a 10% monthly growth rate of followers.  The referral traffic from our social channels became the third largest behind organic and direct traffic.•	Launched and managed the company’s first blogging platform that focused on industry education, maintaining customer relations and real-time communications.   •	Led the web development team in the programming and design of all marketing websites, microsites, landing pages and Salesforce integration projects.•	Led the development of a lead data management and data enhancement platform for all incoming leads tied to Salesforce and Silverpop. This resulted in a 100% improvement in lead geo-location data for email targeting.

Softwyre was one of the leading web agencies and software development firms in the Arkansas region.  As a key individual at Softwyre, primarily worked with customers to develop web sites, web based products and marketing strategies. Responsible for owning the customer experience, translating user requirements into prioritized product requirements, and setting measurable goals for product launch.• Led the web design, ASP.NET software development teams at Softwyre.  Directly responsible for increasing company sales by 150% in the first year of operation and 400% the second year, reaching $1M in new sales for web and marketing services.  • Started and launched the Sales team by recruiting and training sales representatives. Provided and customized the sales enablement tools for this team to manage leads and meet sales goals. • Regularly achieved an improvement of search engine visibility for customers to the first page for customers using white hat SEO tactics with keyword placement, microsites, landing pages and improved copy. • Developed email marketing strategies and social marketing campaigns for businesses resulting in improved sales lead generation of 30% and an average of 25% less bounce traffic. • Led and mentored the web design team in UX concepts and strategy.  This has led the team to begin regularly winning design awards in usability and presentation with industry peer groups.• Organized collaborations between customer executives, product champions, outside agencies and software development to create business requirements and technical specifications for desktop and AJAX based Web 2.0 business applications.

Responsible for ensuring that client web projects were completed on time, correctly and within budget.  Grew and managed a team of web developers, UI designers and software architects.  In this role, also acted as the business analyst with the customer to understand their needs by writing proposals, use cases and communicating these needs to the web development team.As the number of clients grew, became more engaged with the customer to help them understand how to take advantage of using their new websites and software systems to gain competitive advantages in their industry and expand the functionality of their websites to continue to meet their customer needs.The technical aspects of the job included web design in Photoshop for a wide range of customers, ASP.NET C# programming, SQL development and analytics implementation.

summary: After leaving Google as a Marketing Leader, I started Click Laboratory, a digital marketing agency.  We help garage startups, Fortune 100 companies and ministries take the guesswork out of marketing.  The idea of using customer data and analytics to understand how visitors engage with your brand has had a large impact for our customers. I've spent the last 20+ years as a digital marketing and technology leader for companies like Google, BMC Software and AT&T as well as small startups, including my own. I've lead the startup of new social media teams, lead generation, SEM and SEO teams, creative and agile programming teams.
